text: I’m still seeing them ... but less
Any points on why a company should go for a rebuild from scratch instead of a free HubSpot port when they move their existing website to HubSpot? :)

Hi <@U2PDTMH53> we also work for agencies and one of our last jobs for an agency has been to rebuild some of the templates made for free for a client for better user editing, pagespeed best practices are not applied and not very good CSS work. They didn't spend so much as if they had it rebuild from scratch from us but they don't have the better build website possible
and had lost time with all this fixes

thanks <@U2Q5LPHGS> It’s a tricky situation, I know since is free HubSpot is doing they’re best under the circumstance, but the client has to choose between FREE and £2000+ … and since the decision maker are often not very technical the decision is most like going to be for the FREE option. To steer them away from that we, to a degree, have to point out HubSpot’s “mistakes”, so to speak

I looked online, but no dice … they have a post for example where they compare HubSpot to wordpress … was hoping to find something similar … not necessarily HubSpot port vs rebuild … but something along those those line
I understand, but just make them aware there will be a need for a smaller budget for fixes over the HubSpot work
